1303.title: VR Game Development with Unity & 3DMax
1303.description: A team of students of IVE (TY) will introduce the tools that they used to build a VR game - “Time of Wizard”.

1302.title: Getting started with VR view for HTML
1302.description: This codelab will teach you how to embed 360 degree VR media into websites using VR View. This technology is designed for developers of traditional apps to enhance them with immersive content. For example, VR view makes it easy for a travel app to provide viewers with an underwater scuba diving tour as they plan vacation or for a home builder to take prospective buyers on virtual walkthrough before the home is built. VR View is available not only on web pages, but also for Android and iOS. There is a companion codelab to this one which introduces VR view in Android.

1301.title: An Introduction to Tango
1301.description: In this talk, we will cover the core technologies of Tango, some of its application and how it brings new opportunities for developers in different categories of applications.  We will end the talks with some cool live demos on a Tango device.

1202.title: Hands on GKE
1202.description: Google Container Engine is relatively new product in the GCP family. You will know everything you need to know to start with.

1201.title: Architecting a scalable ecommerce system
1201.description: E-commerce system may face sudden burst of load in some occasions. We will show you how GCP can solve this problem.

1104.title: Getting the right place
1104.description: Many of the apps nowadays use different Google Maps APIs. Homing will discuss the considerations that should be made in leveraging the Maps API with examples of some widely used mobile apps.

1103.title: Sesame Open door (芝麻開門)
1103.description: David will show you how to develop a cloud-based real-time open door app to work with RaspPi, in order to open the door.

1102.title: Prediction API: How popular my article will be?
1102.description: Kinni will share how to use Google Cloud Prediction API to build a Machine Learning model to predict the popularity (view count) of news article.

1101.title: I have a Web, I have an App, Boom, Progressive Web App
1101.description:
Progressive Web Apps is a new way to deliver amazing user experiences on the web. It is Reliable, Fast, and Engaging.

In this session, Fung will give you a very brief introduction on PWA. No coding is involved.

Don’t come if you have attended #PWADevSummit.

1011.title: Combining the power of Google Maps solutions in your Apps
1011.description: Combining the power of Google Maps solutions in your Apps

1001.title: GDG DevFest Hong Kong 2016 Opening
1001.description: Official start of the conference. Greetings from the organizers, sponsors and partners.

1000.title: Registration
1000.description: Get your badge, enjoy talking with tech edicts around
